result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Everett Rinde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED
-Consecutive to Count 2 in 14CF312.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
-Court reserves on credit for time served. Attorney Schwab to submit calculated credit within 10 days. If not agreed upon, 20 days granted for argument.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: 14CF312

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Follow all recommended programming as directed by Agent.
-Defendant to participate in MRT.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Michael Wink, Jordan Wink, Matthew Hayes, Madison Koepke, Kenneth Bierl or Samantha Gillis.
-Random and regular testing.
-Continue with mental health treatment.
-Defendant to maintain employment.
-Defendant to provide a DNA Sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

AMENDED - Includes  14CF100, 14CF122, 14CF214, 14CF312, 14CF324, 14CT82.

  X_SIGNATURE BOND:   X Defendant and/or  __ Surety guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $5000.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Michael and Jordan W. or Matthew H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Ashely I., Crystal W. or Andrew H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Kenneth B. or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Report to St. Croix County jail every Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.  Testing can be done at the discretion of the court upon reasonable suspicion.  

- If DE is in an inpatient treatment facility DE is exempt from testing.

- DE is to have contact with probation agent as directed by the agent.  

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
